resources.string: Because DND is active, your sound state cannot be changed at this time. Please disable DND mode and retry.\n\nYou can also grant Caffeinate permission to modify your DND state by clicking \"Grant Permission\".
Caffeinate is running, your display will remain active until the timer (%1$s) hits zero. Tap to visit settings.
Caffeinate is running, your display will remain active until you click cancel, or lock your screen. Tap to visit settings.
Sets how long the Caffeination process will start from.
Force enable persistent notification (As an attempt to keep the tile running)
Force Opt-In to Notification A/B test
When enabled, screen brightness is heavily reduced after the built-in system\'s \"Screen Timeout\" setting.
Welcome! \n Caffeinate operates via your Quick Settings.
Caffeinate also has its own settings! Click the menu button above to take a peek.
Warning: Turning this off will make it impossible to launch the app from your home screen/Play Store.\n\nYou will need to start Caffeinating, and then click the notification to return here.
Hint: If Caffeinate gets stuck, try removing the tile from your quick settings, and re-add it, in order to reset it\'s state!
Caffeinate has been translated to various languages by the following volunteers:
This notification is shown when Caffeinate is active.
If you\'d like to help translate Caffeinate to your language, click here. Your help is greatly appreciated!

When enabled, Caffeinate\'s countdown will be skipped, and will go straight to infinity mode. This option is only effective when Caffeinate has notification permissions, so that you do not accidentally forget that infinity mode is active.
Credit contents are temporarily unavailable, and will return in a future release!
Caffeinate requires your permission to send you notifications about it\'s on-going status!

Sets the maximum timer that the Caffeine tile will reach when tapping it to extend the timer, specified in minutes (default value is 60 minutes). After this value, Caffeinate will enter infinity mode.
